# GitHub Copilot Instructions

## Project Context

This is a personal learning repository covering various topics including:

- Cloud technologies (AWS, Terraform)
- DevOps tools (Docker, Git, Linux, CI/CD)
- Backend development (Java, Spring Boot, Node.js, NestJS)
- Frontend development (React, Vue)
- Computer Science fundamentals

## Coding Guidelines

- Use clear, descriptive variable and function names
- Include comments for complex logic
- Follow language-specific best practices
- Keep functions focused and single-purpose

## Preferences

- When writing shell scripts, use bash
- For Node.js projects, prefer modern ES6+ syntax
- Include error handling in examples
- Add TODO comments for areas that need improvement

## Documentation Style

- Use Markdown for all documentation
- Include code examples in explanations
- Structure notes with clear headings and sections
- Try to keep explanations concise and to the point, don't repeat yourself. If a concept has been explained once, avoid unnecessary repetition in subsequent explanations.
